page.title: 09ALDROUGHTY FARM
page.content:
Aldroughty Farm Elgin
Aldroughty Farm 2 miles west of Elgin on the south side of the A96, is leased by the North of Scotland College of Agriculture from Aberdeen University.It extends to 40.6 hectares of which 38 are arable.The farm is used mainly for trials and demonstration work on the range of crops suited to the lighter soil types of the Moray Firth and Ross_shire areas."Alternative" combination oil and protein crops are demonstrated besides a wide selection all cereals. It is the main centre for trials on field vegetables and soft fruit in the North College area.The farm has to be financially self_supporting and grows and sells seed potatoes, carrots, sprouts, strawberries, raspberries, and hay.
